item.title: Amy add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mary Kay Ash
item.description: "The greatest polution problem we face today is negativity. " -- Mary Kay Ash

item.title: Amy add a quote by M.T.
item.description: "I think resentment is when you take the poison and wait for the other person to die" -- M.T.

item.title: Amy add a quote by Jane Wagner
item.description: "Reality is the leading cause of stress amongst those in touch with it." -- Jane Wagner

item.title: Amy add a quote by Thomas Mann
item.description: "No man remains quite what he was when he recognizes himself." -- Thomas Mann

item.title: Amy add a quote by Bill Waterson
item.description: "Talking with you is sort of the conversational equivalent of an out of body experience." -- Bill Waterson

item.title: Amy add a quote by Margaret Halsey
item.description: "Whenever I dwell for any length of time on my own shortcomings, they gradually begin to see mild, harmless, rather engaging little things, not at all like the staring defects in other people's characters." -- Margaret Halsey

item.title: Amy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Amy add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "To sit back hoping that someday, someway, someone will make things right is to go on feeding the crocodile, hoping he will eat you last - but eat you he will." -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Amy add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Amy add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "From now on, ending a sentence with a preposition is something up with which I will not put." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Amy add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Amy add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "I find the great thing in this world is not so much where we stand, as in what direction we are moving - we must sail sometimes with the wind and sometimes against it - but we must sail, and not drift, nor lie at anchor." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

item.title: Amy add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love." -- Christopher Morley
